maml:description.maml:para: Compares the language text files in two folders (original and modified) and calculates the deltas. The result of the comparison is a language text file per object with the calculated delta.

Use the Compare-NAVAppApplicationObjectLanguage cmdlet to calculate the delta between an original version and modified version of language text files. The resulting delta language text files can then be included in a NAV App package by using the New-NAVAppPackage cmdlet.

The Compare-NAVAppApplicationObjectLanguage cmdlet compares all of the language text files in the two specified folders and creates a delta language text file per object that includes the differences. The language text files to compare must be in the format of exported multilanguage files created by using the Export-NAVApplicationObjectLanguage cmdlet or the Development Environment. You can compare two language text files that contain multiple application objects or multiple language text files containing a single object, or any combination therein. The cmdlet will compare the translations for all objects across all of the language text files in the specified folders.

The cmdlet creates a language text file per object that includes all of the translated \*ML properties and text constants (deltas) for that object. For example, you export the text strings for the Business Central objects that you will be providing translations for to text files in a MLORIGINAL folder. You then put a copy of the exported text file into a MLMODIFIED folder and add your translated strings directly to the file.

You then use the Compare-NAVAppApplicationObjectLanguage cmdlet to compare the language text files in the MLORIGINAL and MLMODIFIED folders, saving the resulting delta language text files to a MLDELTA folder. Then when using the New-NAVAppPackage cmdlet to create the NAV App package, the MLDELTA folder is provided for the -SourcePath parameter.
Specifies the folder containing the original language files to compare.
Specifies the folder containing the modified language files to compare.
Specifies the folder where the calculated delta language files will be placed.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation to overwrite an existing file at the given path.
Specifies the folder containing the original language files to compare.
Specifies the folder containing the original language files to compare.
This is an alias of the OriginalPath parameter.
Specifies the folder containing the modified language files to compare.
Specifies the folder containing the modified language files to compare.
This is an alias of the ModifiedPath parameter.
Specifies the folder where the calculated delta language files will be placed.
Specifies the folder where the calculated delta language files will be placed.
This is an alias of the DeltaPath parameter.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation to overwrite an existing file at the given path.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example compares the language text files in the MLORIGINAL and MLMODIFIED folders, creating the resulting delta language text files in the MLDELTA folder. When the comparison completes, a summary is shown.

This example compares the language text files in the MLORIGINAL and MLMODIFIED folders, creating the resulting delta language text files in the MLDELTA folder. The -Confirm parameter specifies that the user must confirm the process. When the comparison completes, a summary is shown.

This example compares the language text files in the MLORIGINAL and MLMODIFIED folders, creating the resulting delta language text files in the MLDELTA folder. The -Force parameter specifies that an existing file in the delta folder with the same name will be overwritten without prompting the user. When the comparison completes, a summary is shown.

This example compares the language text files in the MLORIGINAL and MLMODIFIED folders, creating the resulting delta language text files in the MLDELTA folder. The -PassThru parameter returns a FileInfo object for each delta language file that is created by the comparison. When the comparison completes, a summary is shown.

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the specified permission set(s) from a Business Central database to a file.
Use the Export-NAVAppPermissionSet cmdlet to export a permission set (or multiple permission sets) from a Business Central database to a file.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the path to the Extension Package file that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Specifies the permission set ID(s) that will be exported.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Returns an Extension object for the published Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Specifies the permission set ID(s) that will be exported.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the path to the Extension Package file that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Returns an Extension object for the published Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
By property name: PermissionSetId
By value and by property name: ServerInstance
By property name: Path

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example exports the permission set with the ID "PSA-VIEW" in the database that is used by the BusinessCentral server instance to the PermissionSet.xml file.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- EXAMPLE 2 ----------
command:example.dev:code:
$PermissionSetFile=Export-NAVAppPermissionSet -ServerInstance BusinessCentral -Path '.\PermissionSet.xml' -PermissionSetId PSA-VIEW -PassThru
Mode LastWriteTime Length Name ---- ------------- ------ ---- -a--- 8/5/2017 11:47 AM 450 PermissionSet.xml

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example exports the permission set with the ID "PSA-VIEW" in the database that is used by the BusinessCentral server instance to the PermissionSet.xml file, and then returns the location of the file to a variable. The variable could then be used when creating a package. (Example: Get-NAVAppManifest -Path '.\Manifest-Proseware SmartStuff.xml' | New-NAVAppPackage -Path 'C:\Proseware SmartStuff.navx' -SourcePath C:\NavExtensionFiles, $PermissionSetFile

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the specified custom report layout from a Business Central database to a file.
Use the Export-NAVAppReportLayout cmdlet to export a custom report layout from a Business Central database to a file.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the Code of the report layout that will be exported.
Specifies the path to the Extension Package file that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Returns an Extension object for the published Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Specifies the tenant from which to export data. If the server instance is configured for single tenant, do not set the parameter.
Specifies the Code of the report layout that will be exported.
Specifies the tenant from which to export data. If the server instance is configured for single tenant, do not set the parameter.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the path to the Extension Package file that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Returns an Extension object for the published Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
By property name: LayoutCode
By property name: Tenant
By value and by property name: ServerInstance
By property name: Path

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example exports the report layout with the code 'MS-1016-DEFAULT' in the database that is used by the BusinessCentral server instance to the ReportLayout.layoutdata file.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- EXAMPLE 2 ----------
command:example.dev:code:
Export-NAVAppReportLayout -ServerInstance BusinessCentral -Path .\ReportLayout.layoutdata -LayoutId MS-1016-DEFAULT -PassThru
Mode LastWriteTime Length Name ---- ------------- ------ ---- -a--- 11/25/2017 11:47 AM 450 ReportLayout.xml

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example exports the report layout with the code 'MS-1016-DEFAULT' in the database that is used by the BusinessCentral server instance to the ReportLayout.layoutdata file, then returns the location of the file.

maml:description.maml:para: Exports data from a Business Central database table to file.

Use the Export-NAVAppTableData cmdlet to export table data from a Business Central database to a file. The data must be for a new non-company table created as part of the extension package to which the exported file will be included.
Specifies the Business Central Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as BusinessCentral.
Specifies the path to the folder where the export file should be written. A data file with a name of TAB<TABLEID>.navxdata will be created. (Example: TAB10000.navxdata)
Specifies the table ID to export. The ID must be for a new non-company table created as part of the extension.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the tenant from which to export data. If the server instance is configured for single tenant, do not set the parameter.
Specifies the Business Central Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as BusinessCentral.
Specifies the tenant from which to export data. If the server instance is configured for single tenant, do not set the parameter.
Specifies the tenant from which to export data. If the server instance is configured for single tenant, do not set the parameter.
This is an alias of the Tenant parameter.
Specifies the path to the folder where the export file should be written. A data file with a name of TAB<TABLEID>.navxdata will be created. (Example: TAB10000.navxdata)
Specifies the table ID to export. The ID must be for a new non-company table created as part of the extension.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
By value and by property name: ServerInstance
By property name: Tenant
By property name: Path
By property name: TableId

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example exports the data from the table with the ID 10000 in the default tenant database for server instance BusinessCentral to a TAB10000.navxdata file in the current folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the specified web service from a Business Central database to a file.
Use the Export-NAVAppTenantWebService cmdlet to export a web service from a Business Central database to a file.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the object ID of the web service that will be exported.
Specifies the object type of the web service that will be exported.
Specifies the path to the Extension Package file that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Specifies the service name of the web service that will be exported.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Returns an Extension object for the published Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Specifies the tenant from which to export data. If the server instance is configured for single tenant, do not set the parameter.
Specifies the service name of the web service that will be exported.
Specifies the object type of the web service that will be exported.
Specifies the object ID of the web service that will be exported.
Specifies the tenant from which to export data. If the server instance is configured for single tenant, do not set the parameter.
Specifies the tenant from which to export data. If the server instance is configured for single tenant, do not set the parameter.
This is an alias of the Tenant parameter.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the path to the Extension Package file that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Returns an Extension object for the published Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
By property name: ServiceName
By property name: ObjectType
By property name: ObjectId
By property name: Tenant
By value and by property name: ServerInstance
By property name: Path

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example exports the web service with the name "Customer" on the Page 21 object in the database that is used by the BusinessCentral server instance to the TenantWebService.xml file.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- EXAMPLE 2 ----------
command:example.dev:code:
Export-NAVAppTenantWebService -ServerInstance BusinessCentral -Path .\TenantWebService.xml -ServiceName Customer -ObjectType Page -ObjectId 21 -PassThru
Mode LastWriteTime Length Name ---- ------------- ------ ---- -a--- 11/25/2017 11:47 AM 450 TenantWebService.xml

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example exports the web service with the name "Customer" on the Page 21 object in the database that is used by the BusinessCentral server instance to the TenantWebService.xml file, then returns the location of the file.
